title.value: Managing extreme AI risks amid rapid progress
title.justification: This is the official title of the paper as stated at the beginning.
title.quote: Managing extreme AI risks amid rapid progress

extractions.description: The paper discusses the potential risks associated with the rapid development of advanced AI systems, including social harms, malicious uses, and the loss of human control. It proposes a comprehensive plan that combines technical R&D with proactive, adaptive governance mechanisms to better prepare for these risks.

type.justification: The paper provides a theoretical framework and a set of recommendations for managing the risks posed by advanced AI. It does not present empirical data or experiments.
type.quote: In this short consensus paper, we describe extreme risks from upcoming, advanced AI systems.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on the safety and ethical concerns related to the rapid advancements in AI technology.
name.quote: Only an estimated 1-3% of AI publications are on safety.

name.justification: A significant portion of the paper is dedicated to discussing governance mechanisms to handle AI risks.
name.quote: We urgently need national institutions and international governance to enforce standards preventing recklessness and misuse.

name.justification: The paper discusses the ethical implications and social responsibilities in the development and deployment of AI.
name.quote: It is vital to both address ongoing harms and anticipate emerging risks.

name.justification: GPT-4 is mentioned as an example of a non-autonomous model adapted for various tasks.
name.quote: For example, the non-autonomous GPT-4 model was quickly adapted to browse the web, design and execute chemistry experiments, and utilize software tools, including other AI models.

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not contribute the GPT-4 model; it is referenced as an example.
is_contributed.quote: For example, the non-autonomous GPT-4 model was quickly adapted to browse the web, design and execute chemistry experiments, and utilize software tools, including other AI models.

is_executed.justification: There is no indication that the model was executed as part of the research described in the paper.
is_executed.quote: For example, the non-autonomous GPT-4 model was quickly adapted to browse the web, design and execute chemistry experiments, and utilize software tools, including other AI models.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not numerically compare GPT-4 to other models.
is_compared.quote: For example, the non-autonomous GPT-4 model was quickly adapted to browse the web, design and execute chemistry experiments, and utilize software tools, including other AI models.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The GPT-4 technical report is the referenced paper for this model.
